Here we're storing only clients that can be associated with some Flowable process. That's because there's a Flowable listener that removes them from this cache when the process finishes, but there's no such thing for clients that are created in our REST controllers. Theoretically, if the cache wasn't memory-sensitive they would stay in it forever, which would eventually cause an OOM error. Your change makes it so that every client is stored. This would work thanks to the memory-sensitivity, but it would still be less optimal than what we have currently, so I don't think this refactoring is a good idea.
